New Records: Kyle Tucker surpassed 100 RBIs for the season, leading the American League with 101 RBIs.
Key Match Events: Yordan Alvarez hit a solo homer in the third inning.
Kyle Tucker added two RBIs in the fifth inning.
Ryan Pressly secured his 30th save by striking out Manny Machado and Xander Bogaerts.
Jurickson Profar hit a two-run homer for the Padres.
Luis Campusano added two hits and an RBI for the Padres.
Phil Maton pitched a perfect fifth inning for the Astros.
Seth Lugo gave up seven hits and six runs in 4 1/3 innings for the Padres.
Héctor Neris retired Ha-Seong Kim and Fernando Tatis Jr. with bases loaded to preserve the lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Yordan Alvarez and the Houston Astros emphasized the need to improve their home record as the regular season winds down.
Post-Match Reflections: Yordan Alvarez reflected on the team's resilience and quality despite battling health issues throughout the year.
Dusty Baker highlighted the importance of consecutive hits and momentum in the game.
Héctor Neris emphasized the bullpen's role in supporting the team and maintaining the lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros increased their lead in the AL West to 1 1/2 games over Seattle.
The Astros achieved their fourth win in five games.
The Astros have a home record of 36-35 at Minute Maid Park this season.
